description: Smallest value of pi(x) having n*pi(x) = x.
comments: Golomb shows that solutions exist for each n>1.a(n) is the smallest natural number m such that m = pi(n*m). For all known terms of this sequence the relation, " 2.4*a(n) < a(n+1) < 2.7*a(n) + 7 " is true. A038627(n) gives number of natural solutions of the equation m = pi(n*m). - _Farideh Firoozbakht_, Jan 09 2005
references: S. W. Golomb, On the Ratio of N to pi(N), American Mathematical Monthly, 69 (1962), 36-37.
links: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Prime Counting Function.
author: _Jud McCranie_
extensions: One more term from _Farideh Firoozbakht_, Jan 09 2005
Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_ at the suggestion of Chris Caldwell, Apr 08 2008
